name: Veracruz-Style Fava Bean Stew
description: I made a hearty stew of dried fava beans Veracruz-style. It is comforting, spicy, tangy, and it pairs perfectly with rice.

recipeInstructions.text: Place fava beans in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a simmer and let cook for 40 minutes or until the beans are tender.
recipeInstructions.name: Place fava beans in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a simmer and let cook for 40 minutes or until the beans are tender.

recipeInstructions.text: While the beans are cooking, heat oil in a large pot set to medium heat. Add onions and sweat for 3-4 minutes or until the onions are tender and translucent. Add the garlic and cook for 2 more minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: While the beans are cooking, heat oil in a large pot set to medium heat. Add onions and sweat for 3-4 minutes or until the onions are tender and translucent. Add the garlic and cook for 2 more minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour the crushed tomatoes over the onions and simmer for 3 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour the crushed tomatoes over the onions and simmer for 3 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the olives, capers, oregano, pickled jalapeños, and bay leaf. Mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the olives, capers, oregano, pickled jalapeños, and bay leaf. Mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Drain the cooked fava beans and add them to the pot with the onion mixture.
recipeInstructions.name: Drain the cooked fava beans and add them to the pot with the onion mixture.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour 1 cup of vegetable broth into the pot and simmer for 15 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Season to taste and serve with rice.
